results.title: The Craic
results.creator_credit: Ted Emery, Jimeoin McKeown, Marc Gracie, David Foster, Australian Film Commission, Geffer Notice, Foster Gracie and Crack Pty Ltd
results.brief_description: Craic is Irish slang for a laugh or a good time, which is what this comedy about two Irishmen on the run in Australia is all about. Fergus (Jimeoin) and his best friend Wesley (Alan McKee) are living in Belfast when they incur the wrath of violent IRA leader, Colin (Robert Morgan). Since Ireland no longer seems like a safe place to stay, they head for Sydney, where they manage to find work despite not having the necessary work permits. Fergus gets a chance to appear on TVs “The Dating Game” and wins a vacation to Queensland. However immigration authorities become aware of the friends’ illegal status and Wesley tracks down Fergus, just in time to meet up with Colin who has come to Australia as part of the witness protection program. Thus a mad chase ensues as Fergus and Wesley head for the outback with immigration agents, secret service men and IRA renegades hot on their trail.

results.title: Heavy petting
results.brief_description: Using footage from Hollywood in the 50’s and 60’s and educational material from the era, known personalities reflect on what it was like to be a living, breathing, sexual being in the 1950’s or 60’s. People such as Allan Ginsberg, William Burroughs, Sandra Bernhard, Francis Fisher, Frederic Lahey, John Oates and Zoe Tamerlaine discuss issues such as; dating, masturbation, petting, falling in love, menstruation, things you did to look cool, cruising, parties, dances, teen pregnancy, STD, and all the other concerns surrounding being a teenager. Set to a soundtrack of music from the decades in question, this snappy and entertaining documentary presents the viewer with a slice of 50’s and 60’s nostalgia.

results.title: Anna Karenina
results.creator_credit: Julien Duvivier, Alexander Korda and London Film Productions
results.brief_description: Produced in England and released in the US by 20th Century Fox, this handsomely mounted but stolid adaptation of Tolstoy’s classic novel stars Vivien Leigh in the title role as a 19th century Russian gentlewoman who leaves her bureaucrat husband (Ralph Richardson) for a dashing army officer (Kieron Moore).

results.title: Hobson's choice
results.creator_credit: David Lean and British Lion Film Corporation
results.brief_description: Based on Harold Brighouse’s 1915 play, this working-class comedy is set in nineteenth century Salford. Henry Hobson (Charles Laughton) is a drunken Lancashire bootmaker who tyrannises his staff and his three daughters. After refusing to allow his daughters to marry because of the expense involved, he is bought to heel by the eldest (Brenda de Banzie) who rebels against her father’s rule to marry his assistant (John Mills). Together with her new husband she sets up a rival boot shop. Lean’s film won the BFI ‘best film’ award in 1954. With Prunella Scales.

results.title: Videodrome
results.creator_credit: David Cronenberg, Claude Heroux, Filmplan International and Guardian Trust Company
results.brief_description: Sci-fi horror filmmaker David Cronenberg’s diabolical invader is a television show that seduces and controls its viewers. Featuring Deborah Harry as a kinky hostess, James Woods as a cable programmer looking for the ultimate in viewing thrills, this is a pulsating science fiction nightmare about a world where video can insidiously control and alter human life.

results.title: Romance (E)
results.creator_credit: Catherine Breillat, Jean-Francois Lepetit, Canal+, Arte, CB Films (France) and Flach Film
results.brief_description: ‘Romance’ is a sexually explicit film that is more concerned with the psychological implications of sex than the physical act itself. Marie (Caroline Ducey), a young primary school teacher, is deeply disturbed by her narcissistic male model boyfriend’s behavior, who refuses to show her any kind of physical affection, much less make love to her. In an attempt to find a balance between the physical and emotional aspects of love, Marie embarks on a succession of brief encounters of the purely carnal kind with Paolo (played by Italian porn star Rocco Stiffredi), the ultimate latin lover, and Robert (Francois Berleand), an older man, who initiates her to S&M games. Although the film has its source in the French tradition of sexually charged writing that stretches from De Sade to de Beauvoir, Bataille, and Foucault, ‘Romance’ fast became a ‘success de scandale’ for its explicit showing of sex. The film was originally refused classification (ie: banned) in Australia by the Office of Film and Literature Classification for contravening the guidelines of an ‘R’ rating. This decision was later overturned by the Classification Review Board, thus re-igniting (albeit, briefly) the debate of censorship and public morality in Australia. Cast includes Thomas Sagamore Stevenin. In French with English subtitles.

results.title: Catholic boys
results.creator_credit: Michael Dinner, Mark Carliner, Dan Wigutow and Silver Screen Partners
results.brief_description: Set in Brooklyn in 1965, this comedy film focuses on several Catholic school boys who get into ever increasing amounts of trouble with the presiding priests of the Catholic school, St. Basil’s. Michael is the new student who latches onto the class egghead, Caesar, who is constantly picked on by the class bully, Rooney. Rooney intimidates Michael and Caesar into becoming his erstwhile chums and, along with a few other members of the ‘gang’, they receive corporal punishment for minor infractions, disrupting communion and confession and, ultimately, their antics inspire changes in the strict school hierarchy. Cast includes: Andrew McCarthy, Mary Stuart Masterson, Kevin Dillon, Malcom Danare, Donald Sutherland, John Heard and Patrick Dempsey.

results.title: Beyond Rangoon
results.creator_credit: John Boorman, Eric Plestow, Barry Spikings and Castle Rock Entertainment
results.brief_description: Patricia Arquette stars as American doctor Laura Bowman who flees to Burma on a package tour with her sister, Andy (Frances McDormand), following a family tragedy. Rather than achieve the peace and solitude she is desperately searching for, she encounters problems when the clash between peaceful protest and a militant government take an ugly turn. Andy flees the country, but Laura finds herself alone after being separated from her tour group, and without an identity after her passport is stolen at a political rally. She is befriended by a former professor (Aung Ko) who attempts to help her reach the Thailand border, and an allegory is drawn between a young woman’s plight to reach freedom and that of a nation facing political unrest. On their journey they witness firsthand the political struggle encountered by a group of dissidents. Cast also includes Spalding Gray and Victor Slezak.

results.title: Will it snow for Christmas? = Y aura-t-il de la niege a Noel?
results.brief_description: This is a moving story about a mother and her seven illegitimate children. But far from presenting life as a drudge, Sandrine Veysset conveys the pleasure of a children’s universe wrapped up in a land of dreams, play, and their mother’s love. Focussing on the mother’s extraordinary spirit and resilience in the face of the father’s cruelty and exploitation, this heart-rending story is set against the backdrop of changing seasons and the tough routine of farm life in the south of France. In French with English subtitles.

results.title: The Star maker = L'Uomo Delle Stelle
results.creator_credit: Giuseppe Tornatore, Vittorio Cecchi Gori, Summit Entertainment and Checci Gori Group
results.brief_description: From Guiseppe Tornatore, director of “Cinema Paradiso”, this is a story drenched in the filmmaker’s love for cinema. Set in Sicily in the early 1950s, it is the story of Joe Morelli (Sergio Castellitto), a con man who travels by truck from village to village posing as a film company representative. For a fee, he offers his victims screen tests, using passages from a script of “0
